title: ALK-positive diffuse large B-cell lymphoma: report of four cases and review of the literature
patient: A 70-year-old male patient presented with cervical, axillary and inguinal lymphadenopathy without B symptoms. Bone marrow was not involved. He had a performance status of 2. Cervical lymph node biopsy was done showing a diffuse lymphoma with plasmablastic appearance. LDH levels were within normal limits. SPEP was not performed. Patient was considered stage IIIB. IPI score was 3 out of 5. He received CHOP-21 regimen for six cycles and achieved a complete response. He is alive with 72 months free from recurrence.
